Title: Clam AntiVirus: Integer overflows
Synopsis:
Clam AntiVirus is vulnerable to integer overflows when handling several
    file formats, potentially resulting in the execution of arbitrary code.

Background.Text: Clam AntiVirus is a GPL anti-virus toolkit, designed for integration with mail servers to perform attachment scanning. Clam AntiVirus also provides a command line scanner and a tool for fetching updates of the virus database.

Description.Text: Neel Mehta and Alex Wheeler discovered that Clam AntiVirus is vulnerable to integer overflows when handling the TNEF, CHM and FSG file formats.

Impact.Text: By sending a specially-crafted file an attacker could execute arbitrary code with the permissions of the user running Clam AntiVirus.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.
